name: Dextroamphetamine (Dexedrine)
summary: A potent central nervous system stimulant used to treat ADHD and narcolepsy.
description: Dextroamphetamine is the dextrorotatory isomer of amphetamine, with strong CNS stimulant properties. It increases synaptic concentrations of dopamine and norepinephrine by promoting their release and inhibiting reuptake. Dextroamphetamine is indicated for the treatment of attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and narcolepsy. It has a high potential for abuse and dependence.

sections.text: Dextroamphetamine increases the release of dopamine and norepinephrine from presynaptic storage sites and inhibits their reuptake, leading to increased neurotransmitter levels in the synaptic cleft.

adult.adhd: Start 5 mg once or twice daily; increase by 5 mg at weekly intervals; usual range 5–40 mg/day in divided doses
adult.narcolepsy: Start 5 mg once or twice daily; increase by 5 mg at weekly intervals; usual range 5–60 mg/day in divided doses

pediatric.adhd: Start 2.5–5 mg once daily; increase by 2.5–5 mg weekly; max 40 mg/day in divided doses

items: Extended-release capsules (Dexedrine Spansule): 5 mg, 10 mg, 15 mg

sections.text: IR onset within 30–60 minutes; duration 4–6 hours. XR onset within 60 minutes; duration up to 8–12 hours.

serious: sudden cardiac death in predisposed patients

sections.black_box: High potential for abuse; prolonged administration may lead to dependence.
other: Assess risk of abuse before prescribing
Avoid abrupt discontinuation after prolonged high doses

sections.pregnancy: Use only if potential benefit justifies potential risk
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; avoid or monitor infant closely
sections.pediatrics: Approved for children 3 years and older (narcolepsy) and 6 years and older (ADHD)
sections.geriatrics: Use with caution; increased sensitivity to cardiovascular effects

sections.text: Gradually reduce dose to avoid withdrawal symptoms such as extreme fatigue, depression, and sleep changes.

items: More potent on a milligram basis than mixed amphetamine salts
May be used in patients who have suboptimal response to methylphenidate
IR and XR forms may be combined for tailored symptom coverage
